stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the desert-pyramid subsection of the cardboard course, reviews yesterday’s crash fix, realises the current maze layout is flawed, and—after chat discussion—decides to scrap it in favour of a two-storey central-hub design with instant warps to cut back-tracking. Conversation branches into technical tricks, Nintendo takedown worries, home-life anecdotes, and team help (mainly Biobak).

development_findings.summary: BNJ crash from the previous stream has been fixed.
Pre-existing pyramid layout felt confusing and camera-unfriendly; Kaze marks it "unused early concept" and will redesign it.
development_findings.quote: Sucks I did all this but most of this is reusable, so it's fine.

development_findings.summary: New design: a single two-storey central room with ~4+ exits; some exits are one-way instant warps to re-enter upper paths, preventing long returns and red-coin back-tracking.
development_findings.quote: One central room with two stories and four exits … every exit is a red coin.

development_findings.summary: Stage purposely has no boss; the pyramid is an explorative red-coin challenge inside the broader cardboard course.
development_findings.quote: There's no boss in the stage.

development_findings.summary: Concern that players could finish maze without 8 reds triggered need for easy return paths (fall-thru warp, cage shortcut, multiple instant warps).
development_findings.quote: We might go through the entire maze without collecting all eight coins … I want the player to easily be able to get back up here.

development_findings.summary: Entire level is inside a cardboard-themed world with several biomes (snow, castle, desert).
development_findings.quote: This right here is the pyramid section of the cardboard level.

development_findings.summary: Uses own engine 'Kanki' plus Fast64 exporter; discovered zero-cost vertex-colour trick for Mario model using Cycle 1 alpha.
development_findings.quote: I added vertex colors … it’s 100 free of cost.

development_findings.summary: Plans camera culling via F3D’s built-in functions for performance in tight indoor areas.
Overall progress: Course 14’s first third built (8/12 tunnels); expects main game content finished in 2025, then beta phase.
development_findings.quote: We’re probably going to finish all the main content in 2025, but there’s still beta left.

development_findings.summary: All bosses in the hack will be custom; no vanilla Mario 64 bosses will be reused.
development_findings.quote: The idea of reusing a vanilla SM64 boss seems insane to me.

development_findings.summary: Release will be free; Kaze may upload a copyright-free trailer to reduce Content ID risk and expects possible DMCA about a week after launch.
development_findings.quote: Last time I made a big hack I uploaded it with a copyright-free trailer … maybe I do that again.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values efficiency/frugality (e.g., hates washing dishes by hand, lives as if earning $7k/yr).
context_findings.quote: I never buy anything … I still just live like I make $7,000 a year.

context_findings.summary: Domestic anecdote: broken water pitcher led to disagreement with Zeina about dish storage; highlights at-home dynamic.
context_findings.quote: Do you think it was my fault that it broke or Zeina’s? We’re not a hundred percent in agreement.

context_findings.summary: Creative principle: because the game is free, Course 1 must be ‘absolute peak’ to hook players; investment differs from paid games.
context_findings.quote: If the first level is not good you’re not invested … the fact that this game doesn’t cost money is bad news for us.

context_findings.summary: Emotion cycles—worry about camera, frustration at scrapping geometry, optimism about reusable assets.
context_findings.quote: It sucks I did all this … it’s fine, it’s fine.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on originality: rejects over-used hub-maze trope, wants ‘something new’.
context_findings.quote: It’s something that’s been done a million times before; I wanted to try something new.

context_findings.summary: Expresses annoyance at ubiquitous AI features intruding on workflow (e.g., Notepad AI).
context_findings.quote: Why did they add AI to Notepad? … it just starts writing garbage onto my script.

biobak.summary: Will ‘move’/polish pyramid textures; Kaze defers to him for aesthetic cleanup.
biobak.quote: I know it looks poopy right now but Biobak said he’s gonna move it so I’m not worrying about it for now.

biobak.summary: Provides quick reference lists (e.g., flying-pig games); often supplies rapid research or joke material during stream.

zeina.summary: Currently away for weekend with their 3-month-old; stay-at-home mom handling primary childcare.
zeina.quote: Zeina is out for the weekend with the baby.

zeina.summary: Prefers hand-washing dishes, leading to time-efficiency debates with Kaze.
zeina.quote: Zeina was insisting she wanted to do it by hand for the longest time and I told her you’re wasting your time.

key_stories.title: Pivoting the Pyramid
key_stories.summary: Kaze finished a complex maze layout for the pyramid but realised play-flow and camera were poor. After chat suggestions, he scraps the design and drafts a new hub-and-warp structure.
key_stories.challenge: Existing geometry was confusing, required repeated stair-jumps, and risked coin back-tracking.
key_stories.process: Walk-through, chat feedback, white-board style sketching of tunnel networks, marking old file as ‘unused early concept’.
key_stories.outcome: Commits to redesigned two-storey central hub with instant warps, re-using salvageable parts.
key_stories.key_quote: Sucks I did all this but most of this is reusable … I’m taking notes here.

key_stories.title: Domestic Dish-washer Debate
key_stories.summary: A broken pitcher exposes differing household philosophies between Kaze and Zeina, shedding light on their personal dynamic.
key_stories.challenge: Pitcher broke because sink was full of dishes; disagreement over whose fault and whether to hand-wash.
key_stories.process: Kaze recounts incident, polls chat, defends time-saving appliances.
key_stories.outcome: No resolution but illustrates Kaze’s efficiency mindset and couple’s give-and-take.
key_stories.key_quote: I told her you’re wasting your time, but she wanted to do it.

key_stories.title: Zero-Cost Vertex Colour Discovery
key_stories.summary: While tweaking Mario’s model, Kaze figures out how to add vertex colour and shoe shine using existing blend modes without extra performance cost.
key_stories.challenge: Wanted richer shading without increasing triangle or texture count.
key_stories.process: Experimented with Cycle 1 alpha blend, lerping into black.
key_stories.outcome: Enhanced visuals at ‘100 free’ cost; technique may inform future assets.
key_stories.key_quote: I added vertex colors … it’s 100 free of cost.

key_stories.title: Preparing for Nintendo’s Hammer
key_stories.summary: Kaze weighs release tactics to survive potential DMCA, drawing on Last Impact experience.
key_stories.challenge: High risk that Nintendo will remove the hack quickly.
key_stories.process: Plans copyright-free trailer, release game for free, accepts likely takedown within a week.
key_stories.outcome: A calculated risk; hopes age of SM64 may spare them.
key_stories.key_quote: It was a calculated risk. I still wanted to do it.
